The year after Bakke,in United Steelworkers of America v. Weber,445 U.S.
193 (1979), the Supreme Court upheld a preferential treatment quota in
employment. Later, in Richmond v. J. A. Croson Co.,488 U.S. 469 (1989), the
Court struck down a local program that set aside a specified percentage of
municipal contracts for minority-controlled firms. Then, in Metro Broad-
casting v. FCC,497 U.S. 547 (1990), the Court allowed a Federal Communi-
